posts.post_content:
Man I remember a guy attacked me with one of these, then he flung it at me with fling, I took 2 damage! well needless to say I was so traumatized by the experience of it I just quit the game, ran home and hid under my bed rocking back and forth clutching a crucifix.
  
   
To think I saw a real Storm Crow, not one of those collector edition ones, or the gold boardered ones from the Tourny decks, but the real thing! if I ever get over my fear I'll ask him if he'll trade me one for my two beta moxes.....probably not though....only an idiot would make that deal....and we all know idiots don't use Storm Crows riiight?

Posted By: shadmed (4/1/2011 12:56:30 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
So last night a friend and I were playing some hot, consensual Magic: The Gathering, and I had just laid down my second island. Of course, you all know what that means. I smiled maniacally and played a Storm Crow.
  
   
My opponent then proceeded to die. Like, I'm not talking about life points, here. He actually *physically died*. He took one look at my Storm Crow and all of his skin melted off like that one scene from Indiana Jones. It was pretty awesome, except now my entire playset of Storm Crows is sitting in the county jail, awaiting a trial for first-degree murder. My lawyers are optimistic though that we can lower the penalty to manslaughter, since Storm Crow doesn't mean to be the ridiculously broken card it is, it was just born that way when [Jace, the Mind Sculptur](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Jace, the Mind Sculptur) and [Black Lotus](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Black Lotus) had a power-baby in the center of the Blind Eternities. So technically, it's not its fault.
  
   
So yeah. This card wins games. Play it.

So technically, it's not its fault.

So yeah. This card wins games. Play it.
